title: England vs New Zealand: Kiwis might grab the spoils on the pitch, but we are the economic winners
text:
England’s rugby team faces its toughest battle yet at the hands of reigning World Cup champions New Zealand.

The All Blacks are globe-dominating titans who routinely demolish the rest of the Queen’s subjects, and everyone else besides.

But can England score a victory on the economic front instead?

Some of the data are for the UK, not England, so apologies to the other home nations where they are unavoidably merged into the statistics here.

GDP per head

Once upon a time New Zealand was notably better off than the UK. Back in the 1960s its GDP per capita was almost always bigger.

That ended abruptly in the 1970s, not helped by Britain cutting trading links by joining the European Community, as...
description: England’s rugby team faces its toughest battle yet at the hands of reigning World Cup champions New Zealand.
